|Description=Beta-blocker in Marfan's disease
|Topic=Management
|Contributors=Myriam Akodad,Florence Leclercq
|Order=12}}

*Medical treatment is indicated in cases of AI with no indication for surgery.
*Treatment is based on :
Hygienic and dietary rules: low salt diet'' **''Pharmacological treatment'': low salt diet''
**Pharmacological treatment'' :
***IEC/ARA 2, +/- diuretics
***In case of Marfan (or dilatation of the ascending aorta): beta-blockers or ARB 2 (Losartan) to slow down the dilatation of the aorta.
**Prevention of infective endocarditis: oral hygiene/6 months, follow-up.
**'''Family screening''' if Marfan's disease or bicuspidia<ins> (first-degree relatives)</ins> **'''Monitoring''' of aortic dilatation in aorta
**'''Monitoring''': clinical, ECG and ETT:
***6 months-1 year in moderate to severe asymptomatic IA.
***Every year if Aorta >40mm
***Every 2 years if minimal IA

question.title: What medical treatment is indicated in cases of Aortic Insufficiency (AI) with no indication for surgery?
question.description: The treatment of AI with no indication for surgery

option_a.title: Only low salt diet
option_a.description: A low salt diet is the only treatment option

option_b.title: Pharmacological treatment with diuretics
option_b.description: Diuretics are the primary treatment for AI

option_c.title: Beta-blockers or ARB 2 (Losartan) to slow down the dilatation of the aorta
option_c.description: Beta-blockers or ARB 2 are the primary treatment for AI

option_d.title: Monitoring and follow-up only
option_d.description: Regular monitoring and follow-up are the only treatment options

correct_option.title: Pharmacological treatment with low salt diet
correct_option.description: Pharmacological treatment is indicated in cases of AI with no indication for surgery
